accounts

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • accounts.Account
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Checking, Savings

    public abstract class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    The Account class is an abstract class, which acts as a framework for the Savings and Checking classes. It is able to check if two accounts are the same or not as well as provide methods to print out the extending classes. It also deals with depositing or withdrawing money from the said accounts.
    Author:
    Jah C. Speed, Abe Vitangcol

      • deposit

        public void deposit(double amount)
        Deposit amount into the balance. Will not work if amount < 0.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount the user wants to deposit.

        Checks if this account is the same as another account.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object of interest to check if this account is the same as it.
        Returns:
        true if the two are the same, false otherwise.

        public boolean isClosed()

        public java.lang.String toString()

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        This account type in a readable string format.

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(double amount)
        Remove the amount from the balance. Will not work if amount is < 0 or > balance.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount the user wants to withdraw.
